name: The Emperor - Beethoven, Shostakovich, Bach

location.name: George Weston Recital Hall, Meridian Arts Centre

description:
Wrapping up the 2025-26 season with works of eternal genius! 

The superb young Toronto pianist Vanessa Yu joins the ensemble in one of the greatest concertos of all time, Beethoven's noble Piano Concerto No. 5, the "Emperor". Music Director Nurhan Arman leads the orchestra in Dmitri Shostakovich's poignant and personal Chamber Symphony in C minor Op. 110a and finishes with the powerful reassurance of J.S. Bach's Contrapunctus 1 and 2 in beautifully transparent orchestral versions.

name: Orpheus Choir: Sound / Space
description:
Enjoy antiphonal performances of works for double choir by Eric Whitacre, Josef Rheinberger, Urmas Sisask, Swani Zubayeer, Hussein Janmohamed, and Caroline Shaw.

We will deliver an unforgettable and immersive choral-spatial experience! Come early for a pre-concert chat by Artistic Director Thomas Burton.

name: Inscape: Scarborough's Shoreline Parks Exhibition
description:
Examine the visual and material tension between wilderness and human control along Scarborough's shoreline park system. Using traditional photographic techniques, the work moves from representational landscape toward abstraction, tracing how natural forces and urban intervention shape one another over time. The project draws from repeated visits to shoreline parks, beaches, and wooded areas along the bluffs. 

About the Artist
Chris is a Toronto-based photographer. Contemplative observation with a strong graphic sensibility for image making, have come to represent his photographic style. His personal work can be found in corporate and private collections throughout North America and Europe.
